# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df)
    df[!,:ym] = year.(df[:dt]).*100 .+ month.(df[:dt])
end
```

This function uses the `year` and `month` functions from the `Dates` module to extract the year and month components of the `dt` column in the input DataFrame `df`. It then concatenates them together by multiplying the year by 100 and adding the month, resulting in an integer in the format "yyyymm". The new column is added to the DataFrame with the name `ym`.
